Interface canShoot


  • public interface canShoot
    This interface ensures that all objects that implement it have both methods required in order to fire a weapon. This is necessary if you want an object to shoot using the methods outlined in this program. An object will not be able to shoot unless it implements this interface.
    Author:
    Andrew

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fireWeapon(Entity target)
      This method holds the logic for the actual firing of the weapon.
      void tryToShoot(Entity target)
      This method acts as a counter for the entity which determines how often it shoots.

    • Method Detail

      • tryToShoot

        void tryToShoot(Entity target)
        This method acts as a counter for the entity which determines how often it shoots. It is implemented in its own way
        Parameters:
        target -

      • fireWeapon

        void fireWeapon(Entity target)
        This method holds the logic for the actual firing of the weapon. This is implemented in various ways for different kinds of turrets.
        Parameters:
        target -
